question_content.barrons:question:
Line l passes through points in both quadrants II and III. Which of the following statements are true?

Indicate all such statements.

barrons:choices.barrons:choice: Line l cannot pass through the origin.
Line l cannot pass through any point in quadrant I.
Line l cannot pass through any point in quadrant IV.
The slope of line l cannot be 0.
The slope of line l cannot be positive.
The slope of line l cannot be negative.

question_content.barrons:explanation:
Choices 1 and 4

The lines in the two graphs below both pass through points in quadrants II and III.

The line in the diagram on the left passes through points in quadrant I and has a positive slope. So statements 2 and 5 are false.

The line in the diagram on the right passes through points in quadrant IV and has a negative slope. so statements 3 and 6 are false.

Statement 1 is true. If a line passes through a point in quadrant II and passes through the origin, it cannot pass through any point in quadrant II.

Statement 4 is true. A line whose slope is 0 is horizontal (parallel to the x-axis). Therefore, if it passes through quadrant II it cannot pass through quadrant III.
